subject: Simsonn haptics issue
description_text:
Hello, good day

I purchased the haptic motors and I'm having a problem: when the ABS
engages and I brake, the motor continues to vibrate even after I release
the brake pedal. Additionally, as you can see in the video, I experience a
very strange vibration when the ABS is engaged, which also affects the car.
The car in the game also starts to stutter, and my braking distance is
twice as long. Furthermore, you still haven't responded to my email from
December 10th. Please refund me for the Z-shaped mounting brackets, as I
haven't received them, as I mentioned in the email. If the problem with the
pedals isn't resolved, I will have to return the haptic motors.


Best regards

conversations.body_text: Hi Ebu Tosun,  We recommend installing the VAM Pro using nylon screws and nylon spacers. This helps electrically isolate the VAM Pro from the motor bracket, effectively preventing motor interference with the pedals.

Hello,
Please refund me for the two Z-shaped mounting brackets. I have not
received them to this day, as I already stated in my email of December 10,
2025, the day I received the pedals.

Best regards

service@simsonn.com
Hi Ebu Tosun,    Okay, we've processed your refund.

Hello,

the problem has improved, however the motors still sometimes vibrate even
though I'm not putting my feet on them. I've also grounded the brake pedal.
What else can I do?



service@simsonn.com

Hi Ebu Tosun,  If this occurs, it indicates that your PC’s grounding may be unreliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used in a grounded wall outlet. You can refer to the post below and connect the three metal screws on the PC case, control box, and pedals, which should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
